instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.ISL9240: What is ISL9240? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2018 through 2020.
definitions.820-01814: What is 820-01814? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP2V5_NAND_SSD0: What is PP2V5_NAND_SSD0? PP2V5_NAND_SSD0 This is a power rail that powers the NAND on Macbooks where the solid state drive is soldered directly to the board. .
definitions.PP1V8_SSD0: What is PP1V8_SSD0? PP1V8_SSD0 is a power rail responsible for powering the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD on newer Macbook Pros.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Not starting
threads.message:
Hi

I got a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01814</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that is stocked on 5v i measured some points and it is like this.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 0v
<SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_TA</SIGNAL> _Vbus  5v
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 5v

I got to replace <CHIP>ISL9240</CHIP> but it is the same.

Please some help.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Not starting
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Not starting
threads.message: It is like an open line, it reads 004

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Not starting
threads.message:
You mean to be short to ground, far away of open line.

Check if any big coil gives the same value to ground.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Not starting
threads.message:
I took of the f7000 and f7001, The pin 2 is shorted to th ground.
If you mean L7030 it reads 300, before and after i took of the f7000, f7001.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Not starting
threads.message:
There are MANY coils on the board.
Start checking the ones close to CPU.

BTW, L7030 is not even connected to <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Not starting
threads.message:
I found out that the board has got a little liquid damage under <CHIP>U9080</CHIP>, and <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> is broken, i desoldered it from the board and the short is gone, and i have 19V.

I replaced it with another one from a donor board, but when i soldered it on the board, the short came back.

I see that the pins on the board are in a bad situation, and i am not sure if i order a new <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> and replace it if it going to work, is there any other way to recover the data from the board now?

I mean can i recover the data with out soldering <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> back?

BTW, it seems that <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> gives power to the nands on the board.

Sorry if i ask confusing questions, i am new :).

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Not starting
threads.message: Internal SSD requires voltage generated by <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> at L9080/81.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Not starting
threads.message: In general damage there kills the NAND chips. Mesure resistance to ground on SSD power rails before wasting time replacing the chip.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Not starting
threads.message:
Just a question, can the board starts with out soldering back <CHIP>U8090</CHIP>? Like if it starts but not find the SSD?

Is it possible?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Not starting
threads.message: T2 has some firmware stored on SSD.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Not starting
threads.message:
I tested to connect the board to adapter with out the <CHIP>U9080</CHIP>, the area around <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> get warm. And <SIGNAL>PP2V5_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> and, <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD0</SIGNAL> is shorted to the ground.


I,m wondering if the NANAs are dead by now or not! any way i can test the if the NANDs are dead or not,?

BTW the NANDs get warm too.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Not starting
threads.message:
Burnt <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> generated overvoltage to NAND.
The board is trash now, good for donor.
